title: QB Rodgers calls out WRs after 'boo-worthy' loss
content: After an injured Aaron Rodgers finished one of the worst passing games of his career, the Steelers QB said he hopes his wide receivers show up during the next film sessions and run the right routes.

title: Bonitto seals win after Broncos switch up call on D
content: After the Broncos tweaked their defensive call during a timeout, linebacker Nick Bonitto swatted away Marcus Mariota's pass on a 2-point conversion attempt to preserve Denver's 27-26 overtime win against Washington on Sunday night.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Kiffin takes LSU job, won't finish year with Rebels
content: Lane Kiffin is the new coach at LSU, and he will not continue with Ole Miss on its College Football Playoff run as the Rebels promoted Pete Golding to head coach.

title: Sources: Spartans target Fitzgerald as new coach
content: Pat Fitzgerald, 50, has emerged as the target of Michigan State's coaching search, sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Sunday night, confirming a report, and the sides are working toward a deal, which is expected to be finalized in the near future.

title: Sources: Kentucky expected to fire Mark Stoops
content: Kentucky is expected to fire football coach Mark Stoops, sources told ESPN on Sunday, with the process set to formally play out Monday.

title: Titans' Chestnut says Jags punter threatened him
content: Titans running back Julius Chestnut alleged that Jaguars punter Logan Cooke threatened to kill him during Sunday's game. "I was just trying to play hard, and he came up to me and said he was going to kill me," Chestnut said.

title: 76ers' Embiid returns in chaotic 2OT loss to Hawks
content: Joel Embiid, Paul George and Tyrese Maxey shared the court for the first time this season Sunday night, but that became a footnote in a chaotic double-overtime loss to the Hawks.

title: üîé How Kiffin's decision impacted sports books
content: How sportsbooks are evaluating Ole Miss and the College Football Playoff race, and more on NFL underdogs winning big on Thanksgiving.

title: Can Ohio State be beaten? Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: 'When do we get our Siakam?': What to make of the Bulls' uneven early season
content: From a 6-1 start to a 9-10 record to begin December, which Chicago Bulls team is the real version and what could be next?

title: Welcome to NFL draft season: 30 questions on the QBs, standout prospects and risers to watch
content: Who's in the hunt to go No. 1? How does the QB class look? Which teams need defense? And who could rise at the combine? Let's answer big questions on this class.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have draft notes, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: The NHL's best this week: Kyle Palmieri, 'hockey guy'
content: The Islanders forward tore his ACL -- then made a brilliant pass to set up a goal. Plus, what to watch this week.

title: Men's Feast Week lessons: Michigan No. 1? St. John's, Florida in trouble?
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a top-25 showdown in New York, here's what we learned last week.

title: Women's Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: VAR Review: Caicedo red card vs. Arsenal, Mateta's penalty retake
content: Chelsea had a player sent off vs. Arsenal, Crystal Palace had to retake a penalty and Wolves saw a goal disallowed for a player in front of the goalkeeper.

title: Awful in first half, magic in second: Joshua Zirkzee leads Man United comeback
content: Man United and Joshua Zirkzee had a poor first half, but one moment of magic turned everything around.

title: Week 13 winners and losers: Bijan Robinson runs wild, Davante Adams makes history
content: Bijan Robinson, A.J. Brown and Patrick Mahomes led the way with big Week 13 performances, while Lamar Jackson, Saquon Barkley and Jaxon Smith-Njigba were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Kentucky fires Mark Stoops: Top candidates, transfers, recruits
content: Stoops departs after 13 years at Kentucky, leaving behind a job that could attract some interesting candidates.

title: As Charlie Smyth shone in debut, Northern Ireland celebrated with free pints
content: The ex-Gaelic footballer turned New Orleans kicker had fans and family rooting for him from near and far.

title: McLaren's Qatar blunder has it on the brink of a 2007 rerun
content: In 2007, McLaren refused to favor either of its drivers, costing the team a title. After another botched call in Qatar, is history repeating itself?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eye Semenyo move in January
content: Manchester City could move to sign AFC Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Govt to back air passengers in SC against Delhi, Mumbai airport operators in Rs 50,000 crore suit
content: The Indian government will back the Airports Economic Regulatory Authority of India (AERA) in a Supreme Court battle against Delhi and Mumbai airport operators. The case concerns a Rs 50,000-crore claim for hypothetical regulatory asset base, which could lead to significant hikes in passenger charges if awarded to the operators.

title: Spying for Pak: BrahMos scientist gets clean chit; was accused of passing sensitive info
content: Nishant Agarwal, a scientist at BrahMos Aerospace Limited, has been cleared of major charges related to passing defense secrets. He was arrested in 2018. The higher judiciary has now absolved him of charges under the Information Technology Act and Official Secrets Act. Agarwal will be released soon, having served his sentence for possessing official documents on his personal device.

title: ‚ÄòImportant to evaluate‚Äô: SC asks Centre to revisit Delhi air pollution action plan
content: The Supreme Court has urged the Centre and authorities to re-evaluate their Delhi NCR air pollution reduction strategies, questioning their effectiveness. The court emphasized examining all contributing factors beyond stubble-burning and noted the unfairness of solely blaming farmers. It highlighted the need to understand why clear skies were visible years ago but not now.

title: 'As easy as making tea': Virender Sehwag hails Virat Kohli after Ranchi hundred
content: Virat Kohli's match-winning 135 against South Africa eased concerns about his form ahead of the 2027 World Cup. The 37-year-old's 52nd ODI century, his 83rd across formats, silenced discussions about his future. Kohli, batting with Rohit Sharma, steered India to a 17-run victory, showcasing his enduring hunger and passion for the game.

title: 'Make sure': Govt asks phone cos to have cyber security app pre-installed; gives 90-day ultimatum
content: India's government is now requiring smartphone makers to pre-install the Sanchar Saathi cyber security app, which cannot be deleted. This move aims to combat cyber threats, track lost or stolen phones, and prevent counterfeit devices. The app, already available, has seen significant downloads and success in blocking and tracing devices since its January 2025 launch.

title: Cory Booker weds Alexis Lewis: Decoding the homosexuality rumours that have persisted for long
content: Senator Cory Booker's recent marriage to Alexis Lewis has reignited long-standing, baseless rumors about his sexuality. These whispers, circulating for over two decades, stemmed from his articulate nature and initial privacy regarding his orientation. Despite his marriage, the internet's tendency to cling to speculation highlights societal discomfort with complexity and stereotypes surrounding masculinity and public figures.

title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu flaunts giant wedding ring as she marries Raj Nidimoru
content: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu wed filmmaker Raj Nidimoru on Monday morning. The couple exchanged vows in a private ceremony attended by close family and friends. Samantha shared wedding photos on Instagram, showcasing her red bridal saree and the joyous occasion. The wedding took place at the Ling Bhairavi Temple within the Isha Yoga Centre.

title: Virat Kohli's siblings draw attention as Team India batter surpasses Sachin Tendulkar‚Äôs world record
content: Virat Kohli's 52nd ODI century, a remarkable 135 runs against South Africa, saw him surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record for most centuries in a single international format. His stellar performance, coupled with contributions from Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul, propelled India to a 349/8 total. India ultimately secured a 17-run victory in the first ODI.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
content: Running out of Gmail storage? Don't panic! This guide reveals how to quickly free up space by clearing trash, deleting large attachments, and managing newsletters. Learn to use Google's Storage Manager to declutter across Drive and Photos, ensuring smooth performance and avoiding costly upgrades. Maintain a clean inbox with simple, regular habits.

title: ‚ÄòStood up for women, paid with his life‚Äô: 20-man gang kills bodybuilder after tiff at wedding
content: A national-level bodybuilder and para-athlete from Rohtak, Rohit Dhankhar, died after being attacked for confronting men harassing women at a wedding. Dhankhar was severely beaten by a group of nearly 20 armed assailants after the wedding ceremony. His family alleges it was a planned murder for standing up for women's dignity.

title: Bomb threat mail spurs massive search at Kerala CM Vijayan‚Äôs house
content: Security was heightened at Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's residence and a private bank following a bomb threat email. Bomb detection teams and sniffer dogs conducted thorough searches, ultimately confirming the threat as a hoax. This marks a recurring incident, with past emails referencing Tamil Nadu political developments.

title: Congress vs Tharoor: MP skips party‚Äôs key huddle; cites travel hurdle
content: Shashi Tharoor missed a key Congress strategy meeting ahead of Parliament's Winter Session, citing travel from Kerala with his elderly mother. This follows previous absences and public praise for Prime Minister Modi, intensifying friction within the party since his presidential election bid.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
content: Over a thousand Amazon employees have penned an open letter, warning that the company's rapid AI development is jeopardizing its climate commitments and human workforce.  They argue the pursuit of AI dominance is leading to increased emissions, water scarcity, and job displacement, urging leadership to prioritize ethical AI and environmental responsibility.

title: Drake Maye buzz: Wife Ann‚Äôs viral gym photo steals spotlight as Giants clash nears
content: New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is electrifying fans with his stellar performance, leading the team to a dominant 10-2 record. Off the field, his wife, Ann Michael Maye, is gaining a significant following on TikTok for her fitness and lifestyle content. Their combined popularity makes them a notable NFL power couple.

title: Final supermoon of the year to be visible December 4; know when, where and how to watch
content: The December 2025 Cold Moon, a supermoon, will be exceptionally large and bright, reaching a high point in the Northern Hemisphere sky. This celestial event, also known as the Long Nights Moon, occurs when the full moon coincides with perigee, its closest approach to Earth. Observers can best witness its impressive size and brightness at moonrise on December 5th.

title: Are you using right air purifier? Doctor sheds light on common mistakes people make when buying one
content: Your room size decides if the purifier will work, or not. Dr Kaushal explains - multiply room square footage by 2-4 for needed CADR. A 200 sq ft bedroom hence, needs 400-800 CADR. Check maker's room size chart-it is usually based on 8-foot ceilings. Open spaces or high ceilings need more power

title: Leon Draisaitl‚Äôs sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid‚Äôs leadership
content: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Smriti Mandhana wedding postponed: Palash Muchhal seen in public for the first time - watch
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal was spotted at Mumbai airport with his family following the unexpected postponement of his wedding to cricketer Smriti Mandhana. Muchhal maintained a low profile, acknowledging photographers with a nod. The wedding was reportedly called off due to Smriti's father's health issues, with Muchhal also allegedly facing health complications.

title: 'Want to live, but what can I do?': UP BLO dies by suicide, another of heart attack amid ‚ÄòSIR stress‚Äô
content: Two Booth Level Officers (BLOs) in Uttar Pradesh have died while working on electoral roll revisions, one by suicide and another from a heart attack. These incidents bring the total BLO deaths during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) exercise to at least seven, raising concerns about workload and pressure.

title: 'If we don‚Äôt break that cycle ‚Ä¶': It‚Äôs raining 'mosquitoes' over Hawaii ‚Äî here‚Äôs the reason why
content: In a unique conservation effort, Hawaii is deploying thousands of lab-reared male mosquitoes via drones and helicopters to combat invasive species threatening native honeycreepers. These specially treated insects, carrying a bacterium that prevents their eggs from hatching, aim to drastically reduce the wild mosquito population responsible for spreading deadly avian malaria.

title: Silver price today: Bullion crosses Rs 1.78 lakh; will it hit Rs 2 lakh mark soon?
content: Silver futures surged to new highs on the MCX, driven by anticipated US Fed rate cuts, a weaker dollar, and strong industrial demand. Experts see a significant technical breakout, with prices potentially reaching Rs 2 lakh by early 2026.  Global markets also show bullish trends, suggesting further upside potential for the precious metal.

title: 'Is there any law?' Congress MP brings dog to Parliament; BJP slams ‚Äòtamasha‚Äô
content: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury sparked controversy by bringing a stray puppy to Parliament grounds, claiming she rescued it from the road. She asserted that "real dogs" who "bite" are already in Parliament, criticizing the government. BJP MP Jagdambika Pal condemned the act as "tamasha" and a breach of protocol, demanding action.

title: 'I‚Äôm not a bad man': Drunk Pune techie driving off in a huff runs over valet
content: A parking attendant in Kalyaninagar tragically lost his life after being hit by a car driven by a reportedly drunk IT employee. The 50-year-old techie, who was refused service at the restaurant, reversed his vehicle, lost control, and fatally struck the attendant before crashing into a wall. The incident occurred near another fatal accident site.

title: Elon's desi beta: A cheatsheet to desi 'heir' to Tesla CEO's fortune
content: The confusion begins with the name itself. There is no ‚ÄúSekhar Musk.‚Äù The child everyone is talking about is named Strider Sekhar Sirius, one of the twins Musk had with Shivon Zilis in 2021. His name follows the familiar Musk pattern ‚Äî a blend of science fiction ambience and cosmic allusion ‚Äî but ‚ÄúSekhar‚Äù stands out precisely because it feels rooted, recognisable and grounded in a very different tradition of knowledge.

title: 5 silent signs of kidney disease beyond changes in urine
content: Kidney diseases are increasingly common, affecting millions, with many unaware of their condition.  About 40% of people with severely reduced kidney function are unaware of it, as per the CDC. Beyond urine changes, silent signs like fatigue, itchy skin, sleep troubles, puffy eyes, and swollen ankles can indicate declining kidney function. Early detection is vital for effective treatment and better outcomes.

title: Haryana lad's murder in UK exposes harsh reality of Indians on foreign soil
content: A disturbing trend of 44 Indian students targeted abroad in just 90 days highlights escalating risks. While violent attacks are few, medical issues, suicides, and accidents claim most lives. Families face immense emotional and financial strain, with calls for enhanced safety measures and systemic support for students navigating a complex global education landscape.

title: Perez Hilton reacts as Meghan Markle accused of keeping $1,700 gown from shoot
content: A resurfaced rumor about Meghan Markle taking a designer gown without permission, dubbed "Green Gown-gate," has sparked debate. Podcaster Perez Hilton defended Meghan, calling the claims "nonsense." Meanwhile, Meghan and Prince Harry actively participated in a Thanksgiving meal packing event through their Archewell Foundation, offering a positive counterpoint to the dress controversy.

title: Ind vs SA: Marco Jansen explains why dismissing Virat Kohli becomes 'near impossible'
content: South African all-rounder Marco Jansen admitted that once Virat Kohli settles in, he becomes 'almost impossible to stop.' Jansen highlighted that the best chance to dismiss batters like Kohli is within their first 10-15 balls. Despite the challenge, Jansen finds it both 'annoying' and 'fun' to bowl to the Indian superstar, acknowledging Kohli's complete batting prowess.

title: Zohran Mamdani, a sharp critic of police surveillance, will soon oversee it
content: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani will retain Police Commissioner Jessica S. Tisch, inheriting her extensive surveillance network, the Domain Awareness System. Despite Mamdani's past concerns about police spying and privacy, he now faces the challenge of balancing public safety with civil liberties, potentially moderating his previous stances.

title: Gross GST collections for November stand at over Rs 1.70 lakh crore; up 0.7 per cent
content: November GST collections surpassed Rs 1.70 lakh crore, marking a slight 0.7% year-on-year increase. Despite this modest rise, the year-to-date performance remains robust with an 8.9% growth. While import GST showed strong momentum, domestic collections and compensation cess experienced declines, with varied state-wise performances.

title: Breakfast pe charcha? Now, DKS 'invites' Sidda for meet
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is slated to visit Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar's residence on December 2, signaling a temporary truce amid internal power tussle. This meeting follows Shivakumar's recent visit to the CM's residence, both aimed at projecting unity as directed by the Congress high command. The move seeks to cool tensions before the legislature session begins.

title: 10 dohas (couplets) by Kabir which offer life's wisdom in a nutshell
content: Kabir, a 15th-century Bhakti poet, challenged religious dogma with his sharp dohas, emphasizing inner devotion over rituals and caste. A rebel disciple, his colloquial Hindi verses spoke to the soul, influencing Sikhs and sparking the Kabir Panth. His legacy continues to inspire a focus on love, questioning, and introspection.

title: 'PM Modi has hijacked Parliament': Gaurav Gogoi hits out as Winter Session begins
content: Gaurav Gogoi accused Prime Minister Modi of "hijacking Parliament" during the Winter Session, alleging the government refuses to discuss the Indian election system. Gogoi stated that while the opposition is willing to cooperate on government bills, the BJP is not accommodating opposition issues in the parliamentary agenda, undermining democratic functioning.

title: 'Speak to a doctor': RS witnesses Kharge vs Nadda over Dhankhar's 'sudden exit' ‚Äî watch
content: Rajya Sabha witnessed a heated exchange between Mallikarjun Kharge and JP Nadda on the first day of the Winter Session. Kharge's reference to the "sudden exit" of former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar drew sharp criticism from Nadda, who advised him to seek medical help for political frustrations.

title: New labour codes: Major shift in India‚Äôs employment regulation‚Äîimplementation is key
content: India's labour laws have undergone a major overhaul, consolidating 29 laws into four codes effective November 21, 2025. This reform aims to boost workplace safety, ease business, and formalize employment. Businesses must adapt to new wage definitions and extended social security, while navigating short-term challenges like cost recalculations and dual compliance environments.

title: 'Awareness‚Ä¶ that's my core': Virat Kohli opens up on mental phase - Watch
content: Virat Kohli's magnificent 135 against South Africa not only secured India's victory but also revealed his current mental clarity. He emphasised 'awareness' of situations and his own emotions as the driving force behind his sustained success. This balanced mindset, cultivated over years, allows him to perform consistently at the highest level.

title: Vintage Virat Kohli: 'Mentally young, hungry, unstoppable' ‚Äî SA great delivers powerful verdict
content: Former South African pacer Dale Steyn lauded Virat Kohli's enduring ODI relevance, highlighting his "mentally young, fresh, and hungry" approach after a match-winning 135. Steyn emphasised Kohli's vast experience and unwavering self-belief, noting the star batter's palpable excitement for playing for India, even at 37. This stellar performance powered India to a 17-run victory.

title: Trump tariffs hit India‚Äôs manufacturing sector! PMI falls to 9-month low in Nov
content: US tariffs have slowed India's manufacturing growth to a nine-month low, impacting sales and production. While exports to other regions remain strong, new export orders saw their slowest rise in over a year. India is negotiating a trade framework with the US to address these tariff challenges, though future output expectations have dipped.

title: Samantha Prabhu weds 'The Family Man' director Raj Nidimoru; actress shares photos
content: Samantha Ruth Prabhu wed Raj Nidimoru today in an intimate ceremony at Isha Yoga Centre's Linga Bhairavi Temple, attended by 30 guests. She wore a red saree. Rumors swirled after Raj's ex-wife's cryptic post; they've been linked since 2024. This follows her 2021 divorce from Naga Chaitanya.

title: Kolkata: Woman 'assaulted, molested' inside moving car for nearly an hour
content: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly drugged, physically assaulted, and molested for nearly an hour inside a moving car after being forced into it near Ambedkar Setu. Police found her abandoned and heavily drugged in the Maidan area and have launched an investigation, reviewing CCTV footage to trace the vehicle and its occupants.

title: 'Payment for betrayal': Man stabs wife over extramarital affair; posts selfie with body
content: A 32-year-old man murdered his estranged wife at a women's hostel in Coimbatore, stabbing her to death over an alleged extramarital affair. He then took a selfie with her body and posted it on WhatsApp with a vengeful message. The accused has been arrested by the Rathinapuri police.

title: Drunk Kerala techie sexually harasses cabin crew on flight
content: A passenger on an Air India flight from Dubai to Hyderabad was apprehended by airport police following allegations of sexual harassment and leaving obscene messages. The accused, identified as Biniyam Nazar, reportedly touched a stewardess inappropriately and left offensive remarks. Authorities registered a case under relevant sections of the law.

title: Ahmedabad man fires six rounds at in-laws‚Äô home after quarrel with wife
content: Panic erupted in Ahmedabad's Subhash Society after Rahul Soni fired six rounds following a domestic dispute with his wife. Soni arrived at his in-laws' residence, argued with his wife, and then discharged firearms outside the bungalow. Police detained Soni and seized the weapons, with no injuries reported.

title: Mumbai businesswoman held at gunpoint, stripped, threatened by pharma officials
content: A Mumbai businesswoman has accused senior pharmaceutical officials of holding her at gunpoint, stripping her, and taking compromising photos and videos at their Mahalaxmi office. The FIR details threats of viral dissemination and fabricated legal cases. Police have registered a case under various sections of sexual violence and criminal intimidation, initiating an investigation.

title: PM-led panel to meet on Dec 10 to select Chief Information Commissioner: Centre to SC
content: Seeking an expeditious selection of information commissioners in the CIC, the court had told the Centre that these posts need to be filled at the earliest.

title: Hyderabad: Ocean research, resilience in focus as IIOSC-2025 opens in INCOIS
content: The event provides a platform for scientists working on various facets of the Indian Ocean to present research findings, exchange ideas, identify knowledge gaps, and chart a roadmap for addressing outstanding issues

title: On Bhopal gas tragedy eve, survivors' groups slam BJP over 'denial' of justice
content: One of the groups alleged that American multinational Dow Chemical, which bought Union Carbide in 1999, continues to expand its business in India

title: Coimbatore burglaries: Arrested trio from U.P. planned more loot, reserved AC train tickets for return, say police
content: The accused had confessed that they were not satisfied with the goods stolen from 13 TNHB flats ‚Äî 42 sovereigns of gold, 500 grams of silver jewellery and around ‚Çπ1.5 lakh cash ‚Äî and planned serial housebreaks at Ramanathapuram in Coimbatore city on November 29, before leaving the next day.

title: Karnataka leadership tussle: Round Two of breakfast meeting between CM, DCM on December 2
content: Shivakumar termed the breakfast meeting with Mr Siddaramaiah as a matter ‚Äòbetween brothers‚Äô, stressing that there was no groupism within the Congress government

title: Traffic, not stubble, behind daily pollution spikes in Delhi: Study
content: The report notes that stubble burning in Punjab and Haryana was significantly subdued this year, partly because floods disrupted the crop cycle

title: Govt considering legislative amendments to push private investments in nuclear space: Shripad Naik
content: The Atomic Energy Act currently does not allow participation of the private sector or even State governments in the nuclear projects.

title: SIR exercise Phase-2: BJP delegation visits Bengal‚Äôs Chief Electoral Officer
content: A BJP delegation, led by Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari, visited the office of the West Bengal Chief Electoral Officer triggering loud protests by members of a Booth Level Officer forum

title: Government not averse to taking up discussion on SIR, electoral reforms, says Kiren Rijiju
content: The Minister informed that certain Opposition parties raised matters other than the SIR and stressed the need to protect their rights as well

title: This doctor from Tamil Nadu found his calling in photography in the Himalayan terrain
content: Over the last four years, physician Dr. Srinivasan Periathiruvadi has travelled extensively across Kashmir for his next photography exhibition, planned for 2026, and had also published two books that document his journeys through photographs.

title: 'Beef' in buffet triggers row at Aligarh wedding; samples sent for forensic test
content: Two guests, Akash and Gaurav Kumar, objected to the label and tried to record a video on November 30 at the party, leading to a fracas. police team and Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officials arrived and collected food samples for forensic examination.

title: GCTO accuses Kannur University of violating norms by fixing exams on Saturdays
content: Government norms allow only five working days a week, with Saturdays becoming working days only in emergencies, it says

title: Rohingya refugee and rape victim lives in fear in Bengaluru
content: Woman alleges that the accused are Bangladeshi migrants who have a rivalry with her husband and brother-in-law

title: MP Abhishek Banerjee hits back at Prime Minister Narendra Modi
content: Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee's remarks came hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the House was ‚Äònot a place for drama but for delivery‚Äô

title: Untreated sewage, missing effluent plants key reasons for Yamuna's pollution: Govt
content: Minister of State for Jal Shakti Raj Bhushan Choudhary added that Delhi generates 11,862 tonnes of solid waste daily but has the capacity to treat only 7,641 tonnes, leaving a gap of 4,221 tonnes.

title: More details of financial mismanagement in Kerala BJP-controlled cooperative society surface
content: BJP State general secretary S. Suresh had on November 19 dismissed the allegations when a part of the order became public. However, detailed report of 25 pages has details contradicting his assertions

title: Those sitting inside bite: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury on row over bringing rescued stray dog to Parliament
content: BJP MP Jagdambika Pal accused Ms. Chowdhury of indulging in a "tamasha" (theatrics) and violating protocol by bringing a dog to Parliament

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Massive rainfall pounds Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh on alert
content: Parts of Tamil Nadu saw heavy rain on December 1 as the remnants of Cyclone Ditwah hovered near the Tamil Nadu‚ÄìPuducherry coasts. Strong winds reported at Marina Beach. The system has weakened into a deep depression. Meanwhile, Andhra Pradesh officials in Prakasam, SPSR Nellore, and Tirupati have issued alerts

title: In an extraordinary move, Supreme Court unleashes CBI on ‚Äòdigital arrest‚Äô scammers
content: Considering the magnitude of the scams and the widespread tentacles of the fraudsters, the apex court directed the CBI to coordinate with the Interpol to identify cybercrime havens abroad and crack down on their operations in India

title: Lok Sabha passes resolution for election of two House members to IISc Bengaluru Council
content: Lok Sabha approves election of two members to IISc Bengaluru Council, enhancing governance and strategic development of the premier institution

title: 18th Bihar Assembly commences with swearing in of newly elected members
content: The session comes close on the heels of the assembly polls in which the ruling NDA won a brute majority, bagging 202 out of 243 seats

title: Winter session: Parliament panels get more time to submit reports on insolvency, Jan Vishwas provisions Bills
content: Lok Sabha has allowed time till the last day of the Winter session for report on the Insolvency bill, and end of second week of session for Jan Viswas Bill report

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Nellore, Tirupati continue to receive light rain on December 1
content: On December 2, heavy rain, accompanied with squally winds with speed reaching 40- 50 kmph, and gusting up to 60 kmph, is likely at isolated places across Andhra Pradesh

title: PM Modi announces ex-gratia for bereaved families of Sivaganga road accident
content: At least 11 persons were killed and 50 others were injured when two buses of the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) collided near¬†Nachiyarpuram¬†at¬†Thirupathur¬†in¬†Sivaganga¬†district

title: Need framework to deal with challenge of biological weapons: Jaishankar
content: ‚ÄòMisuse‚Äô of biological weapons by non-State actors is no longer a distant possibility and international cooperation is needed to combat such a challenge, says External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar

title: Maharashtra woman ‚Äòmarries‚Äô corpse after kin kill man she loved over caste differences
content: Videos of Aanchal Mamidwar‚Äôs act at the deceased youth‚Äôs house and her call for her family to be hanged for the killing went viral on social media

title: ATF price hiked by 5.4%, commercial LPG rates cut
content: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum revise Aviation Turbine Fuel and Liquefied Petroleum Gas prices on the first day of every month based on international benchmarks and the exchange rate

title: Decathlon opens multi-sport ecosystem at Whitefield in Bengaluru
content: The 60,000 sqft store can host coaching sessions for basketball, football, skating, pickleball, and gymnastics, along with workshops, a kids‚Äô zone, a yoga and dance studio, weekly cycling and running meetups, sports birthday parties

title: Supreme Court declines to entertain plea for time extension to upload waqf details on UMEED portal
content: Supreme Court emphasises adherence to UMEED portal deadlines, allowing petitioners to seek relief from the waqf tribunal amid concerns over technical issues hindering property registration

title: BJP-ally IPFT to maintain separate political entity: Party president Prem Kumar Reang
content: The statement came days after the Tipra Motha Party organised a rally under the banner of 'One North East'

title: Watch: Israel‚Äôs Netanyahu seeks pardon in years-long corruption trial
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has formally submitted a pardon request amid ongoing corruption trials, calling the long-running cases ‚Äútearing the country apart‚Äù.

title: Tamil Nadu government and iVP Semi launch ‚ÄòTN 100 Chip Varsity‚Äô project to build semiconductor talent network
content: The project has a dual mandate: enabling the development of 100 new chip designs and training 5,000 students in advanced semiconductor design skills annually.

title: Bomb threats to Kerala CM‚Äôs residence, private bank in capital city ahead of President‚Äôs visit
content: E-mail received by Chief Minister‚Äôs Office reportedly claimed that RDX explosives have been planted by a group involving LTTE and a Karachi-based Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) cell. Police launch extensive checks

title: India's manufacturing sector activity falls to 9-month low in November on softer rise in sales, production: PMI
content: The seasonally adjusted HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers‚Äô Index (PMI) fell from 59.2 in October to 56.6 in November, highlighting the slowest improvement in operating conditions since February

title: Rajya Sabha witnesses heated exchange as Kharge brings up former V-P Dhankhar‚Äôs ‚Äòsudden exit‚Äô
content: LoP Kharge brought up the ‚Äúcompletely unexpected and sudden exit‚Äù of Jagdeep Dhankhar from the office of the Chair of Rajya Sabha

title: Supreme Court to hear plea against forcing Tamil Nadu Anganwadi workers into BLO work under threat of punishment, job loss
content: Senior advocate Gopal Sankaranarayanan said Anganwadi workers were under ‚Äúsevere pressure‚Äù to attain ‚Äútargets‚Äù in the distribution of enumeration forms for the SIR

title: Thane court acquits all seven accused in cable theft case filed under MCOCA
content: Special MCOCA court judge V.G. Mohite ruled that the entire chain of evidence suffered from major legal and procedural lapses

title: Punjab Vigilance Bureau arrests close aide of jailed Akali leader Bikram Majithia
content: Harpreet Singh Gulati, who is in the liquor trade, was arrested on Saturday, they said. During the probe, the Bureau detected a transaction of ‚Çπ10 crore between Gulati's companies and firms run by the Majithia family

title: Parliament is a place for delivery, not drama: PM Modi
content: The Winter Session of Parliament must be a platform for result-driven debate, Modi said, and offered to give the Opposition tips on bringing ‚Äòpositivity into politics‚Äô

title: ED notice to Kerala CM ‚Äòa joke‚Äô, says KPCC chief Sunny Joseph
content: Sunny Joseph says the notice will have ‚Äòsame plight as previous¬†ones‚Äô issued by ED against Chief Minister and his son

title: Mayawati calls for smooth Winter Session of Parliament to address key public issues
content: In a post on X, the former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister cautioned that, like previous sessions, the Winter Session is expected to witness considerable uproar

title: India evacuates last batch of stranded citizens from Sri Lanka, intensifies relief efforts
content: Under Operation Sagar Bandhu, the last batch of 104 Indian passengers stranded at Bandaranaike International Airport in Colombo reached Thiruvananthapuram, onboard an IAF aircraft

title: VMRDA sets May 2026 deadline for seven road projects linking Vizag to Bhogapuram airport
content: Road projects have slowed down owing to land acquisition challenges, with the toughest hurdle being the takeover of 75 acres; on the other hand, validation flight at the international airport is scheduled to take place this month

title: CM Rio renews demand to lift Protected Area Permit regime from Nagaland
content: The CM said that although the Centre has relaxed the PAP requirement for Nagaland from December 1 to 10 to facilitate the Hornbill Festival, the temporary measure "does not solve the larger issue"

title: ED issues show-cause notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in KIIFB masala bond probe
content: Former Finance Minister T.M. Thomas Isaac and KIIFB Chief Executive Officer K.M. Abraham too receive notices. ED notice is related to alleged use of funds raised through the bonds to purchase land and alleged violation of FEMA norms

title: Mamata to scale up anti-SIR campaign with rallies in Malda, Murshidabad, Cooch Behar
content: This marks Ms. Banerjee's second phase of anti-SIR mobilisation after her Bongaon rally last week in the refugee-dominated Matua belt

title: In Kothamangalam, LDF banks on legacy, UDF on unity, and BJP on change
content: The LDF is seeking to retain the municipality for a second consecutive term; The UDF is confident of wresting back power by presenting a united front.

title: Kerala local body election: Factionalism, poor candidate selection cost Congress dear in 2020 polls, says Mullappally Ramachandran
content: Former KPCC chief feels that candidate selection should not be left to the whims of individual leaders. He says differences among top leaders would dampen the spirits of grassroots-level workers and hence they should be resolved at the earliest

title: Kerala local body polls: Echoes of landslide in Meppadi‚Äôs electioneering
content: Survivors of the 2024 tragedy will return from various parts of Wayanad, where they now live in rented houses, to cast their votes. As the polls approach, we focus on  candidates themselves, not their parties, because none of them seems any different, says a survivor

title: Kerala local body polls 2025:  Thrissur sees a political ‚Äòpooram‚Äô ahead of polls
content: LDF‚Äôs development pitch, UDF‚Äôs revival push, and BJP‚Äôs expanding footprint are setting the stage for one of the most anticipated civic battle in the State

title: Still prefer to call Bangladesh a friend, hope situation there turns around: CNS Admiral Tripathi
content: The CNS said that he remains eternally optimistic and confident that things will turn around as far as Bangladesh is concerned

title: Parliament Winter session Day 1 LIVE updates: Both Houses stand adjourned
content: Lok Sabha adjourned for the day after FM Sitharaman tabled three Bills on GST, health security and excise; Rajya Sabha adjourned after taking up listed matters

title: NIA raids eight locations in Kashmir in 'white-collar terror' module case
content: The NIA teams conducted searches at eight locations in Pulwama, Shopian and Kulgam districts of Kashmir

title: Extension of deadline for Special Intensive Revision of poll roll welcome: councillors
content: A councillor says that some BLOs want the process to be done quickly, as this work keeps them away from their civic responsibilities

title: Councillors call for return to zone-wise roadwork tenders
content: A councillor says that when a single contractor handles multiple areas, some places receive less attention; he alleges that contractors with connections to ruling party often dodge responsibilities

title: Parliament Winter Session: Sitaraman introduces two bills in Lok Sabha to replace GST cess on tobacco, pan masala with new levies
content: The Central Excise Amendment Bill, 2025, and The Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025, will ensure that the tax incidence on sin goods like tobacco and pan masala remains the same after discontinuation of the compensation cess

title: Trinamool Congress accuses Election Commission of India of leaking info to BJP leaders
content: From day one, Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders have created a sense of fear among common people by repeatedly claiming that one crore names will be removed from the voter list in the state, TMC MP Partha Bhowmik said

title: A wall that connects, in a flood that‚Äôs wrecked life and livelihood
content: More than three months after floods submerged this village and large parts of the State, reptiles and insects, some poisonous, now live in the water, making this strip of wall both a lifeline and a hazard for these families.

title: SIR extension proves that the revision is a hurried process, says Trinamool
content: The EC on Sunday announced the extension of the schedule of the ongoing SIR of electoral rolls in nine States and three Union Territories by one week

title: Young candidates infuse new energy into poll campaign
content: Political parties are fielding young candidates, some as young as 21 or still in college, who are taking on seasoned politicians and bringing much-needed enthusiasm to the local body elections

title: BJP has been ‚Äòsplitting parties‚Äô for its entire history: Maharashtra minister
content: He said, the BJP poached one of his family members during the Assembly elections and has since poached a member of MP Rajabhau Waze‚Äôs family

title: West Bengal government directs digitisation of waqf properties on UMEED portal
content: ‚ÄòExisting Registered Waqf Properties‚Äô are to be uploaded by the respective mutawallis within six months from the date of launch of the UMEED portal, the State government has said

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Nearly 90,000 hectares of farmland submerged in Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Cauvery delta
content: Initial reports say standing paddy crop in Mayiladuthurai, Karaikal, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, and Pudukkottai have been damaged due to rain caused by Cyclone Ditwah

title: Bangladeshi nationals leave India via Hakimpur border checkpost amid rising SIR fears
content: Many say they are returning after watching videos of departure and fearing arrest under ongoing SIR exercise

title: Top leaders add zest to campaigning in Kozhikode Corporation
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan, Congress Working Committee member Ramesh Chennithala, and senior BJP leader V.K. Sajeevan join candidates as campaigning peaks

title: Edappadi Palaniswami accuses Sengottaiyan of betraying AIADMK
content: Resuming his Makkalai Kaappom, Thamizhagathai Meetpom tour in Gobichettipalayam, he launches a scathing attack on the expelled leader and former MLA of the constituency, who joined actor Vijay‚Äôs TVK last week

title: Assam CM is stoking conflict, says Gaurav Gogoi
content: After a Group of Ministers‚Äô report proposed a three-tier classification of STs to accommodate the demand of six communities for ST status, the Congress leader says the report has failed to convince that the rights of existing ST communities will remain intact. He accuses Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of doing ‚Äòdivide and rule‚Äô politics.

title: IPFT to hold protest in Delhi demanding autonomous Tipra Territorial Council through Constitutional amendment
content: Party leaders say they have not given up the demand for a separate tribal State but primarily sought the setting up of Tipra Territorial Council in line with the Bodo Territorial Council

title: Rajasthan revokes controversial order to mark December 6 as Shaurya Diwas after drawing flak
content: The directive proposed essay competitions on themes such as Indian cultural pride and the Ram Mandir movement

title: Congress discusses Centre‚Äôs stance on SIR, National Song
content: Opposition parties may stall Parliament proceedings till the government agrees to their demand for a debate on the SIR, sources said

title: MHA writes to Governors and L-G‚Äôs to consider renaming Raj Bhavans as Lok Bhavans
content: Letter cites colonial associations in existing names; West Bengal and Ladakh change names after receiving the letter

title: Youth to take out rally in Dharwad today to get vacant posts filled
content: Meanwhile, police refuse to give permission for rally as the organisers have ‚Äònot followed the due process‚Äô

title: Cyclone Ditwah weakens; 3 die in rain-related incidents in Tamil Nadu
content: Light to moderate rain is likely at isolated places over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry-Karaikal on December 1, with thunderstorms and lightning at a few places. Heavy rain is likely at isolated places in Tiruvallur district, according to the Regional Meteorological Centre bulletin.

title: 'GPS Spoofing Didn't Hit Flight Ops': Centre A Month After Delhi Airport Chaos
content: GPS spoofing in and around Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) - the country's busiest - didn't disrupt any flight operations, the government said

title: "My Family Betrayed Us": Woman Who 'Wed' Lover's Body After Caste Murder
content: Days after Saksham Tate (20) was beaten to death in Maharashtra's Nanded over an inter-caste relationship, his lover, Anchal Mamidwar (21), has alleged that two cops were among the several people who provoked her brothers to attack Saksham.

title: Mass Voter Deletion Allegations In Bengal "False": Poll Body To Supreme Court
content: Allegations of "large-scale voter deletion" in West Bengal are "false" and "fabricated" and an attempt to further vested political interests, the Election Commission has told the Supreme Court in an affidavit.

title: 'Predictable': Awami League Slams Court's Verdict Against Hasina, Family
content: The Awami League on Monday rejected the verdict by a Dhaka court against former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and her family members in a case filed by the country's Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC).

title: Stubble Burning Down By 90% In Punjab, Haryana, Centre Informs Parliament
content: Union Minister Bhupendra Yadav said that while farm fires remain an episodic contributor to winter pollution, Delhi's air quality is influenced by multiple factors, including vehicular emissions, industrial pollution and construction dust.

title: Man Dozes Off, Drives Off Flyover Near Delhi, He Survives But Father Dies
content: A speeding car broke through the railing of the Rajnagar flyover here on Monday and plunged nearly 50 feet into the premises of a PWD office below, leaving a 48-year-old man dead and his son injured, police said.

title: Video: Supriya Sule Dances To Dhol Beats At Nephew's Wedding
content: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) MP Supriya Sule danced her heart out at the wedding of Yugendra Pawar, the grandson of NCP chief Sharad Pawar, on Saturday.

title: Top Court Grants 'Free Hand' To Probe Agency In Digital Arrest Investigations
content: The CBI has been directed to identify police officers from each state who will help in the investigation, while Interpol assistance will be sought when cases have an international angle.

title: 'Will Go If He Invites': Siddaramaiah On DK Shivakumar's Proposed Meeting
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Monday said that he still has not received a call from Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar inviting him for breakfast at his residence, adding that he will go whenever he is invited.

title: Tuition Teacher Charged For Sexually Assaulting 4 Girls In Arunachal Pradesh: Cops
content: Four girls, all aged around six to seven years, were allegedly sexually assaulted by their private tuition teacher in Arunachal Pradesh's Naharlagun, police said on Sunday.

title: Inside Lalit Modi's Lavish London Birthday: Dance, Lights And Vijay Mallya
content: In the videos, a specially created birthday track plays in the background, repeating the line, "Happy birthday, Lalit. King of smiles".

title: Top Court's "Blue Skies, Stars During Covid" Remark During Pollution Hearing
content: The Supreme Court on Monday told the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) and state authorities in the National Capital Region (NCR) to come up with a clear, time-bound, and "actionable" strategy to address Delhi's recurring air pollution.

title: KIIT BTech Student Dies By Suicide In Hostel Room, 3rd On Campus This Year
content: The body of a first-year B Tech student of KIIT was found hanging in his hostel room here, police said on Monday.

title: 3 Tehreek-e-Taliban Terrorists Killed After Attacker Blows Himself Up In Pak
content: Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan, referred to as 'Fitna-al-Khawarij' by the Pakistani state, is a banned group.

title: Video: Elephant Charges At Ambulance Carrying Injured Worker In Kerala
content: An ambulance carrying an injured migrant worker in Kerala's Idukki district had a close call after a lone elephant charged at the vehicle.

title: 35% Minority Discrimination Complaints In 2024 From UP: Centre In Parliament
content: Uttar Pradesh had the highest number of discrimination complaints from minority communities in the country in 2024, accounting for 35 per cent of all cases, according to the Union government's report to Parliament.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Scindia's Ghost Is Haunting Congress Again - This Time In Karnataka
content: As Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar stakes his claim to the top post, the party's high command is walking a tightrope, acutely aware that one misstep could lead to a repeat of the catastrophic loss it suffered in Madhya Pradesh in 2020.

title: UP Woman's Jaw Dislocates While Eating Golgappas, Condition Critical
content: A 42-year-old woman ended up dislocating her jaw while opening her mouth to eat golgappas in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district on Saturday.

title: Congress Chief's Jagdeep Dhankhar Redux In Rajya Sabha Leaves BJP Fuming
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday congratulated Vice President CP Radhakrishnan on taking over as Chairman of the Upper House, while simultaneously voicing disappointment at not being able to bid farewell to his predecessor Jagdeep Dhankhar

title: The Unresolved Questions Of Face Transplantation 20 Years On
content: James Partridge, severely burned in a fire at 18, spent his life advocating for people with "visible difference" through charities like Changing Faces and Face Equality International.

title: Big win, better trolls: Panthers poke fun at Rams after upset
content: the Carolina Panthers beat the los Angeles Rams 31-28 at home . it marked the fourth quarter's seventh upset victory of the season . the Panthers posted a photo of a "W" shaved onto a Ram .

title: Michigan State fires Jonathan Smith: Top candidates, transfers, recruits
content: the Spartans had an AP top-10 finish as recently as 2021, when they finished 11-2 and won the Peach Bowl after awarding then-coach Mel Tucker a record contract . a second-year coach was fired Sunday with a final record of 9-15 . the program has quickly lost all national relevancy .

title: AP Week 14 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: Texas A&M lost its spot in the SEC championship game and its undefeated season . the rest of the teams in position to reach the CFP all managed to win . let's break down the rankings .

title: Projecting Tuesday's penultimate CFP top 12
content: 11 of the committee's top 12 teams won during Rivalry Week . the r√©sum√©s are complete, with exception of teams that will play for their respective conference championship games . a fifth and penultimate ranking Tuesday night will be the best indicator all season .

title: Will there be baseball in 2027? Is a salary cap coming? What you need to know about MLB's looming labor battleÔªø
content: the league's current labor agreement expires on Dec. 1, 2026 . there are major hurdles to clear and some key areas of disagreement . a lockout would shut down free agency and trades, as it did in 2021 .

title: Survivor Series WarGames: Who is the masked man who attacked CM Punk?
content: mystery fighter interrupts main event of WarGames to help Brock Lesnar, Bron Breakker and their team win . AJ Lee pinned Becky Lynch in the women's wargames match . that's the biggest question after Saturday's Survivor Series .

title: Who is NBA Cup MVP? Can anyone stop OKC? Big questions ahead of the quarters
content: the Emirates NBA Cup wrapped its group stage Friday to set up four matchups, each with a trip to Las Vegas at stake . the group stage is set to begin on tuesday . a panel of insiders is breaking down another year of thrilling group stage play and previewing the quarters .

title: Fantasy Football Buzz: Meyers leads Jags WRs again; Bucs' Irving solid in return
content: fantasy football buzz aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the league . the former Raider led all Jacksonville Jaguars pass-catchers in targets, converting all six of his looks for 90 yards and a score .

title: Giants see success for Jaxson Dart if he can avoid injury
content: Eli Manning was in during garbage time of a blowout loss to the Philadelphia Eagles . it was the last play of the rookie's first career game during the 2004 season . "that was my 'Welcome to the NFL' moment for sure," his father says .

title: ePlane Company targets 1st flight in 2 months; ambulance certification in 2027
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines ‚Äî Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few ‚Äî  but is based out of Bengaluru, India‚Äôs science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ.
